com.cloudera.oryx.kmeans.common

Class KMeans

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.kmeans.common.KMeans

  • public final class KMeans
extends Object
    An in-memory implementation of the k-means algorithm that can be configured to create various numbers of clusters using different KMeansInitStrategy initialization strategies and updated with different KMeansUpdateStrategy rules. For more details on k-means and its properties, please see the Wikipedia page.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KMeans()
      Constructor that uses the k-means++ initialization strategy and 100 iterations of Lloyd's algorithm.
      KMeans(KMeansInitStrategy initStrategy, KMeansUpdateStrategy updateStrategy)
      Creates an in-memory k-means execution engine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Centers      		 compute(List<W> points, int numClusters, org.apache.commons.math3.random.RandomGenerator randomGenerator)
      Apply the configured k-means initialization strategy followed by the k-means update strategy for the given list of points to yield the given number of clusters.

        Creates an in-memory k-means execution engine.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        public <W extends Weighted<org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector>> Centers compute(List<W> points,
                                                                                        int numClusters,
                                                                                        org.apache.commons.math3.random.RandomGenerator randomGenerator)
        Apply the configured k-means initialization strategy followed by the k-means update strategy for the given list of points to yield the given number of clusters.
        Parameters:
        points - The weighted points to cluster
        numClusters - Number of clusters to create
        randomGenerator - The RandomGenerator to use for initialization
        Returns:
        The Centers created from the computations
